alert.note: Alert for Northern Panhandle (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Dense Fog Advisory issued January 30 at 4:00AM MST until January 30 at 10:00AM MST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...DENSE FOG ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM PST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Visibility down to 1/4 mile or lower in dense fog. * WHERE...Oroville, Clark Fork, Tonasket, Republic, Flowery Trail Road, Bridgeport, Priest River, Okanogan, Northport, Metaline, Highway 20 Wauconda Summit, Inchelium, Disautel Pass, Deer Park, Kettle Falls, Chewelah, Orin-Rice Road, Tiger, Boulder Creek Road, Omak, Newport, Colville, Sandpoint, Athol, Metaline Falls, Bonners Ferry, Chesaw Road, Wauconda, Fruitland, Eastport, Brewster, Sherman Pass, Schweitzer Mountain Road, Springdale-Hunters Road, Nespelem, and Ione. * WHEN...Until 9 AM PST this morning. * IMPACTS...Low visibility could make driving conditions hazardous along sections of Highway 20 and Highway 395 in Washington and US 95 in North Idaho. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Regional cameras are showing varying conditions across the northern mountain valleys of Washington and North Idaho. Some areas are already experiencing visibility below 1/4 mile. Fog will continue to fill across areas not experiencing fog at this time.
info.instruction: If driving, slow down, use your headlights, and leave plenty of distance ahead of you.
